content.description:
This problem climbs the obvious, hanging prow on dark, grey stone. It is a full value highball with great moves and position.

Start on edges, and climb some hard first moves to reach the slopey jug. From here, commit to big moves on decent holds to reach the arete up and left before moving back right and up along the slab until you can top out the boulder.
content.location: This ascends the left side of the downhill face of Hot Fire Bloc.

content.description: Start matched on the jug, and climb through hard moves to get to the cruxy lip encounter.

This problem tackles the beautiful orange face up the center of the boulder. Perfect stone is offset with powerful, technical and committing climbing.

Start with a crimp in a seam and a undercling, and move into another sidepull/gaston combo before jumping to a jug at mid-height. The climbing above is easier but committing.
content.location: It ascends the center of the downhill face.

content.description:
Start at the base of a nice scoop feature. Getting established on the boulder can be tricky. That is followed by an exposed move to a big jug at the top.

The landing has ended up being no man's land between

Narrow Control

and

Hot Fire

. Still it is fun climbing, but falling is probably sucky now.
content.location: It ascends the right side of the Hot Fire Bloc.

content.description:
Backburner is located on the backside of the Hotfire Bloc! Start on small, opposing crimps, and make a large reach out left to an incut. Continue climbing up and left.

Starting on the incut warrants a V6.
content.location: It is on the backside of the Hotfire Bloc!
